class_notes:
Timed, synchronous assessments; timed, asynchronous assessments; asynchronous assessments. Technology required: webcam and microphone, ability to scan written work. Must enroll in Chem 203L.
Student must enroll in CHEM_OX 203L first, then in CHEM_OX 203. Students must be enrolled in both courses or will be dropped at preregistration or Add/Drop/Swap.
course_description: This course will focus on the chemistry of organic and organometallic compounds: specifically, how the molecular orbital theory can be used to predict structures and properties. The course covers kinetics, mechanisms, and catalysis. Students who withdraw from the lecture must withdraw from the co-requisite laboratory course. *Exceptions to the withdrawal policy require Chemistry Department approval
prerequisites:
CHEM_OX 202 and CHEM_OX 202L prerequisites & CHEM_OX 203L corequisite, or transfer credit.
Student must enroll in CHEM_OX 203L first, then in CHEM_OX 203. Students must be enrolled in both courses or will be dropped at preregistration or Add/Drop/Swap.
